Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Schleicher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault AMENDED FROM REPEATED SEXUAL ASSAULT OF SAME CHILD, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Mental Health assessment and sex offender assessment and follow through with recommendations. Do not drive unless properly licensed.  No contact with the victims A.J.S., R.M.S. or A.J.B. (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co defendants S.H. or N.C. (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Joint and Several with the co defendants. Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendency of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. **AMENDED 3/8/2016 to add restitution.**

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, RMS and AJS (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant, NC. No contact w/anyone under the age of 18 yrs old without adult supervision.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
3/30/15 - BOND AMENDED: Defendant to be on house arrest and placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). May attend school, court, atty appointments and treatment appointments. No contact w/anyone who was at the party. No internet or social media use.
08/26/2015 - BOND AMENDED: GPS to be removed. Defendant to be on HOUSE ARREST at home of Aunt in New Berlin. May leave home with Aunt or Grandmother, for court or attorney appointments, or for counseling. May not attend school (virtual school is approved on-line). No contact order remains.
